intro: Ficaria popovii var. abchasica, commonly known as the Abkhazian snowbell, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is characterized by its small, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant features a low-growing habit with hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is typically found in alpine or subalpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
